column4: can someone help me configure my rt61 wireless card setup script at start up? for some reason it wont load all my iwconfig commands in init.d/rt61up
anyone know anything about rt61 cards?
did you try to get it working manually first before using init.d?
yeah it works fine, but when I start up it wont load
what do you mean when you start up? manually?
when I start up I want it to automatically load up the card and connect to the router. When I start up though, when I iwconfig none of the setting are stored
your settings are not stored? check your script carefully
everything in the script seems to be ok, it was all copied and pasted into the startup script
you can have your script debug but putting a -x option on your script at the top
what will that do during start up? will it just step through it like normal code debug?
yeah, i hope so..but you can test it without rebooting, go to single user and back to multi-user
what do you mean?
you can always test your script ..run it manually
as in /etc/init.d/rt61 restart or start..assuming you follow the chkconfig format..
when I run it it goes through the script ending with dhclient ra0, seems to be running normal when I run it
put a comment to spit it out to the /var/log/messages so you know your script runs right?
i don't need to do that, because when it runs through it comes back saying the process id already exist...
dont forget that the other network related scripts may already be running dhcpclient..
can i put them in the network/interface would it run?
sure try it, thats the way its supposed to be anyways,
thanks, I'm going to restart and try it now
